page.title: 12CHESTERTON-FOSSEWAY
page.content: The Fosseway was built early in the Roman Conquest,A.D.42-48.It was a lateral line of communication with forts spread out at regular intervals along it. Chesterton Camp was a small town built along this road. The Fosseway runs from Lincoln via Cirencester and Bath finishing at Exeter and Seaton. It was built wide enough for soldiers to march along it six abreast. The road was built by digging a trench,and at the bottom was put a layer of large stones and flints. Then came layers of rammed chalk and gravel,and finally a layer of stone slabs were put on top to give it a hard surface.
